meanings.definition: The mutual trust and friendship among people who spend a lot of time together.
meanings.sent1: In the army, the soldiers' camaraderies were evident during training exercises.
meanings.sent2: The camaraderies among the classmates grew stronger as they worked on group projects.
meanings.sent3: The camaraderies between the teammates made the long practice sessions enjoyable.
meanings.sent4: Their camaraderies were like a warm blanket on a cold night, comforting and reassuring.
meanings.sent5: The camaraderies in the workplace created a supportive and welcoming environment.

meanings.definition: The spirit of goodwill and loyalty among friends or comrades.
meanings.sent1: During the camping trip, the camaraderies among the friends were palpable.
meanings.sent2: The camaraderies between the siblings were unbreakable, no matter the circumstances.
meanings.sent3: The camaraderies at the family reunion brought laughter and joy to all.
meanings.sent4: Their camaraderies shone brightly, like a beacon of hope in challenging times.
meanings.sent5: The camaraderies among the team members fueled their success and unity.
